page.title: 07Gala Week
page.content: We have a Gala Week to raise funds to improve the town's amenities. The first one was held in 1949 at Millbank and there has been one every year since. The most important parts of the Gala are the open air crowning, floats and weather. The Gala takes place during the second week in July. Flags, decorations and a stage are put up the week before by the Town Council. Loud speaker vans tour the streets telling people about coming events such as swimming competitions, discos, coffee mornings, treasure hunts, baby shows, "It's-a-Knockout" and ceilidhs. They hope to have a mini-marathon and a break dancing contest. The newly crowned Gala Queen leads the procession in a horse drawn carriage followed by the Thurso Pipe Band and floats with people in fancy dress. Last year Â£3000 was raised.
